metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4366 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
http/impl/client/HttpClientBuilder.java in Apache HttpClient 4.3.x before 4.3.1 does not ensure that X509HostnameVerifier is not null, which allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving hostname verification.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libhttpclient-java - 4.3.3-1
libhttpmime-java - 4.3.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: httpcomponents-client package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.3-1').
